content.title: Emeritus Fellowship
content.details: The scheme provides an opportunity to superannuated teachers to pursue active research in their respective field of specialization in Indian Universities/Colleges/Institutions. The number of slots available under the scheme is 100 for Science streams and 100 for Humanities, Social Sciences and Languages (total 200 slots) at any one given time basis.
benefits: Honorarium of Rs. 31,000/- p.m. for two years (non-extendable)

Contingency grant (non-lapsable) of Rs. 50,000/- p.a. towards secretarial assistance, travel within the country connected with the research project, stationery, postage, consumables, books and journals and equipment.
Foreign visit in connection with the approved research work of the awardee will be limited to once in a year with prior approval.
The Emeritus Fellow would be entitled to such other privileges including medical facilities as available to the university faculty members, but not housing.
eligibility: Highly qualified and experienced, superannuated teachers of recognized universities/colleges/institutions.
The eligibility will be based on the quality of research and published work contributed by the teacher in his/her service career.
The awardee can work under this scheme up to the age of 70 years or up to two years (non-extendable) of the award, whichever is earlier.
exclusions: If the awardee is found to be ineligible to receive the award at any point of time during the entire duration of the fellowship.
Any false information furnished by the applicant.
Unsatisfactory progress of research work of the awardee.
content.application_process: Online applications are invited through on line mode once in a year through advertisement in leading newspapers & employment news. Candidates have to apply strictly as per the instructions given in the online portal.
documents_required: Undertaking Certificate from the proposed research centre duly signed by the HOD and Registrar/Principal/Director of the University/College/Institute.
Copy of the Award Letter and Joining Report with photograph, address and contact number.
Form for submitting accounts of contingency grants and the Utilization certificate.

faqs.question: Is this scheme for all teachers?
faqs.answer: No, teachers who have retired but are still interested and wish to participate in teaching and research programs are eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any particular pay slab/scale for retired teachers for their eligibility?
faqs.answer: There are no restrictions on positions and salary scales for teachers who wish to apply under this scheme.

faqs.question: Can school teachers apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, teachers from colleges and universities are only eligible.
